hints.content:
We need to know the total number of beads in the two necklaces.

![A tape diagram models that the 168 beads in the first necklace and 168 beads in the second necklace are equal to an unknown total number of beads.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/a49d82dc6b335f9d4d690a1f510601ada1d1f431)

$\maroonD{168}+\blueE{168} = \purpleD{?}$

$\begin{align}
\maroonD{168}+\blueE{168} &=\maroonD{100}+\blueE{100} + \maroonD{60} + \blueE{60} + \maroonD{8} + \blueE{8} \\\\
&= 200 + 120 +16
\\\\
&=\purpleD{336}
\end{align}$

![Place value blocks show 1 hundred plus 1 hundred plus 6 tens plus 6 tens plus 8 plus 8](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/ac66d6c8e262ec0cee2b5b12caa094c7799841fe)

question.content:
Frida used $168$ beads to make a necklace. Then she made another necklace with the same number of beads.

**How many beads did Frida use in all?**

[[â˜ƒ numeric-input 1]] beads
